oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SOLVENT-EXTRACTION SEPARATION OF GALLIUM WITH 18CROWN6 FROM CHLORIDE MEDIA
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: VIBHUTE, RG
KHOPKAR, SM
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: crown ethers
thallium(iii)
solvent extraction
separation
gallium
crown ether
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Gallium was quantitatively extracted with 0.02 M 18crown6 in methylene chloride from 6 M hydrochloric acid, then stripped with 1 M acetic acid and determined with 2-(pyridylazo)naphthol with measurement at 545 nm. Gallium was separated from indium, thallium. lead, aluminium and bismuth. The method was applied to determination of gallium in bauxite.
